Caution: An AAR that is filed by a partner after the partner has entered into a settlement agreement should not be considered or allowed as IRC
settlement agreement should not be considered or allowed as IRC

) provides that a settlement agreement is binding on all parties to that agreement with respect to partnership items for that tax year. The settlement agreement provide that “the treatment of partnership items will not be reopened in the absence of fraud, malfeasance, or misrepresenta- tion of fact; and no claim for an adjustment of partnership items, or for a refund or credit based on any change in the treatment of partnership items may be filed or prosecuted.”
) A major difference between Claim and AAR procedures is found in the partner is given to file a petition for adjustment or a suit for refund. (

In both instances, however, a suit filed before six months have passed since the taxpayer filed a claim for or a partner filed an AAR. The two year period may be extended by agreement. (

The two year period may be extended by agreement.
